page.title: 10MOFFAT&DISTRICT WILDLIFE
page.content: {BIRD LIFE} Moffat is rich in breeding habitats varying through suburban gardens, parks,low lying moorland and farmland, riverbeds and valleys and finally hill moors and the higher peaks-all within a short distance from Moffat. The Station Park and Lower Waterside are ideal settings for Jackdaws, Starlings, House Sparrows, Swifts, House Martins and Feral Pigeons, Chaffinches, Dunnocks, Blackbirds, Song and Mistle Thrushes, Collared Doves.Half way along the Lower Waterside Rooks, Crows,finches,Pied and Grey Wagtails,Dippers,Willow Warblers,Wood Pigeons and Robins are to be seen. Bordering the Station Park is the River Annan,at this stage barely more than a good sized burn. Gorse bushes provide habitat for Linnets,Redpolls and Buntings.
